image.altText: A brown and black silhouette of a man's face from the side

props.synopsis: A spy for one of the most feared and powerful arms of China’s intelligence apparatus is revealing his identity and operations overseas, including in Australia, as part of a Four Corners investigation.

title.children: For the first time ever, a former spy for China's notorious secret police is going public

image.altText: Jim Chalmers smiles while sitting behind a laptop in his parliament house office

props.synopsis: The outlook for Australia's economic growth is worsening and inflation forecasts remain uncertain as the federal government battles to simultaneously spur growth and rein in rising costs.

title.children: Economic outlook worsening as Labor seeks credit for easing inflation

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers superimposed over falling leaves from the budget tree and parliament house

props.synopsis: With a federal election fast approaching and Australians struggling with the cost of living, Treasurer Jim Chalmers will have to walk a fine line between caution and courage when he delivers tomorrow's budget.

title.children: We've been told to expect a cautious budget, but will it satisfy an impatient public?

image.altText: In a soft-lit reception area with sign reading LASER CLINICS AUSTRALIA, two receptionists stand at a desk

props.synopsis: When franchising works, it works well — but when it doesn't it can be devastating for franchisees and workers. Global cosmetic treatment chain Laser Clinics is shaping up to be another case study in what happens when things go wrong.

title.children: Laser Clinics is facing disaster as franchisees threaten legal action and angry customers spread bad reviews like a rash

image.altText: A composite image of Benjamin Netanyahu and Joe Biden.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden's growing criticism of Israel has left Benjamin Netanyahu having to choose between Israel's strongest supporter, which bankrolls its military, and two far-right politicians.

title.children: Biden's tough talk attracted the wrath of two Israeli politicians. But for Palestinians, it came too late

image.altText: a young boy with a pixelated face gives thumbs up while swimming in a river

props.synopsis: Across Australia there's angst about youth crime, but what do the kids involved think about it? Reporter Erin Parke travelled to the desert to see first hand the hard work and emotional moments involved with trying to "divert" vulnerable kids away from bad behaviour.

title.children: 'We are the naughty kids': At the front line of efforts to stop kids committing crime

image.altText: A man leans over a bench wearing a black tee. In front of him on the bench are various parts of a raw fish

props.synopsis: Australian chef Josh Niland served customers fish eyeball crackers to save his failing restaurant. It rocketed his career into the stratosphere and now the world's top chefs can't get enough.

title.children: Australia's Josh Niland is 'one of the most interesting chefs on the planet'. This is his secret ingredient

image.altText: Vladimir Putin smiling and gesturing while walking with Sergei Shoigu

props.synopsis: In changes certain to be approved by parliamentarians, Russian President Vladimir Putin proposes a surprise new defence minister, nominating civilian Andrei Belousov, a former deputy prime minister who specialises in economics, for the job.

title.children: Putin to move defence chief Shoigu in surprise reshuffle

image.altText: A man in glasses and a white t-shirt holds a book out as a younger girl reads aloud and leans into him in their living room.

props.synopsis: Learning to read in his 40s changed Morris' life. Advocates hope the tactic that worked for him will help millions of others and boost literacy rates.

title.children: We no longer know how many people in Australia are illiterate, but Morris was one of them

image.altText: Dr Andy Schmulow

props.synopsis: A senior partner at PwC Australia took confidential tax information and misused it. The company sold schemes off the back of it and gloated about the millions it had made. But as the scandal dies down, the firm is winning new taxpayer-funded work and may be able to get more from December.

title.children: Back in business? PwC Australia wins new taxpayer-funded contract as government sets date for potentially more

image.altText: Picture of the book called "Same Sex parents". Two men with a boy all smiling.

props.synopsis: There is something deeply troubling about a local council trying to ban books that show the diversity of families that have legal status in our country.

title.children: The Sydney council book ban shows that the ugliness of homophobia is still with us. It deserves a serious response

image.altText: Black snake in ute.

props.synopsis: Lisa Kournelis wears protective gear while driving after four failed attempts to remove a venomous red-bellied black snake from inside her car.

title.children: Snake in a ute a Newcastle woman's ongoing living nightmare

image.altText: An illustrated outline of a woman holding a phone with one hand on her head

props.synopsis: The South Australian government is considering introducing laws against the "unscrupulous" practice, which involves contacting a survivor of abuse or personal injury without their permission to encourage them to make a claim for compensation.

title.children: 'Profiteering off trauma': Calls for nationwide claim farming ban

image.altText: A lighthouse photographed in front of a pink, blue, green and yellow sky

props.synopsis: Robin Moon dropped everything to fly from Sydney to Tasmania to get a good vantage point for Saturday night's spectacular light show. She was one of many people around the country who snapped the amazing colours.

title.children: Aurora australis and borealis put on another spectacular show

image.altText: An aerial shot shows a road split in two as water rushes through where the road used to be,

props.synopsis: Cold lava — a mixture of volcanic material and pebbles — flows down the slopes of active volcano Mount Marapi, destroying houses and cutting roads.

title.children: Cold lava mudslides kill dozens as flash floods hit Indonesian island

image.altText: AFLR9

props.synopsis: Essendon is officially as good as it's been in years, Port Adelaide beats Geelong in the coach's box and the Western Bulldogs show their good side again. Here's this week's AFL wrap.

title.children: AFL Round-Up — The Bombers have arrived, Port's tactical masterstroke and the Bulldogs make a stand

image.altText: A composite image of Latrell Mitchell, Scott Drinkwater and Bradman Best during NRL games.

props.synopsis: Latrell Mitchell's return does little to inspire the Rabbitohs, the Cowboys and Warriors continue to slide, and Bradman Best re-emerges in the State of Origin frame as other options break down. Here's this week's NRL Round-Up.

title.children: NRL Round-Up — Drinkwater drops the ball and Bradman the Best option as injuries ravage Blues

image.altText: A graphic image of a person holding about 10 nangs, which are small cannisters of nitrous oxide.

props.synopsis: It's believed about 600,000 Australians inhale nitrous oxide but there are dangerous complications of misusing the gas — which can lead to paralysis, incontinence, and even death.

title.children: Nitrous oxide is known as 'laughing gas', but experts say its side effects are no joke

image.altText: A man puts a canister of nitrous oxide on the ground.

props.synopsis: At first glance, it would be easy to mistake for an Uber Eats delivery. The driver isn't here to drop off food, though — it's a 3.3 litre canister of nitrous oxide.

title.children: Nitrous oxide has been linked to paralysis and death. We got it delivered to our door

image.altText: A group of young woman walking, wearing t-shirts with a woman's photo and the words "Her name is Molly".

props.synopsis: Several weeks after 28-year-old Molly Ticehurst was allegedly killed by her former partner, her New South Wales home town has paid an emotional tribute to the young mum and childcare worker.

title.children: 'We pay tribute to you': Mother's Day walk to remember 'beautiful and funny' Molly Ticehurst

image.altText: A sinkhole emerging in an affluent Sydney suburb, near the ocean, with rainclouds overhead.

props.synopsis: Chunks of Oceanview Avenue at Dover Heights washed into the ocean on Saturday night when the ground gave way during heavy rain creating a 10-metre sinkhole.

title.children: 'Like a bomb went off': Locals in Sydney's east blast council after sinkhole opens where landslip happened last year

image.altText: Pink lights in the sky over a beach

props.synopsis: The Earth has seen its biggest geomagnetic storm in more than 20 years, creating spectacular auroras across the globe. And the Bureau of Meteorology says the southern lights should be visible again tonight.

title.children: Missed the aurora australis? You should get another chance to see the southern lights tonight

image.altText: A grey haired man in a suit with a blue neck tie smiling.

props.synopsis: Roger Corman was a mentor to many Hollywood greats including Francis Ford Coppola, Ron Howard, James Cameron and Martin Scorsese.

title.children: Roger Corman, the man behind Little Shop of Horrors, dies aged 98

image.altText: An image of people walking on rubble looking for survivors, there is dust in the air.

props.synopsis: The attack in the Russian border city comes as Russia launches a fresh onslaught near Kharkiv.

title.children: Russia blames Ukraine after deadly apartment building blast

image.altText: Darcy Fogarty dives to tackle Jaxon Prior

props.synopsis: The Crows and the Lions have provided the AFL its second draw of the season after a pulsating match in Adelaide, while Collingwood made light work of West Coast.

title.children: Crows and Lions play out pulsating draw in Adelaide after Pies pile pain on Eagles

image.altText: Gold Coast Titans teammates jump on the back of AJ Brimson after a try against North Queensland Cowboys.

props.synopsis: The Titans lose their entire bench but hold on for a 20-18 win over the Cowboys in a Queensland derby on the Gold Coast after the Roosters ride a red-hot start to a 38-18 win over the Warriors.

title.children: Decimated Titans just barely hold on for win over Cowboys after shooting out to 20-0 lead

image.altText: Drone photo of mist over a mountain peak.

props.synopsis: It's one of WA's most popular hikes, but an increasing number of people are becoming stranded on Bluff Knoll, leaving authorities concerned.

title.children: Why are so many people getting rescued from this Australian mountain?

image.altText: Two images of the inside of a home that has had its roof and ceiling badly damaged in a storm. Roof nowhere in sight.

props.synopsis: The clean-up is underway and an asbestos alert is in place after a freak storm ripped through the WA city of Bunbury.

title.children: Residents unable to return home as WA government announces payments of up to $4,000 after Bunbury tornado

image.altText: A composite image of Eurovision performers from Switzerland, Israel and Croatia.

props.synopsis: A controversial Eurovision has come to an end with the winner crowned, earning the winning country its first top honour in more than three decades.

title.children: The highs and lows of Eurovision song contest in Sweden as winner crowned

image.altText: Avatars of ABBA beamed up on stage

props.synopsis: In addition to the sequins, glitter and catchy tunes, there were plenty of controversial moments during Eurovision 2024 — and a tribute to ABBA added to the controversy.

title.children: ABBA avatars catch Eurovision viewers by surprise

image.altText: A group of kids standing in front of an air vanuatu plane

props.synopsis: Air Vanuatu's collapse has left teenage volunteers stranded on the island of Tanna, Vanuatu. Members of an Albury-based Rotary club were running health clinics on the island and paid thousands for their initial tickets, but now face additional expenses of $3,000 per person to get the group home.

title.children: Aussie teens from Rotary club stranded after Air Vanuatu collapse

image.altText: An archival, faded colour photo of a group of people on a rock off the Darwin coast.

props.synopsis: Over half a century, the Darwin Rocksitters have seen romances blossom, shared a drink with Jimmy Barnes and set an incredible world record. This is how it all began.

title.children: 'One big party': Darwin Rocksitters recall 50 years of friendship, mishaps and world records
